title: CDA Chairman for improving health facilities atÂ  Capital Hospital
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 29 (APP):Chairman of the Capital Development Authority (CDA), Muhammad Ali Randhawa, visited the Capital Hospital on Monday to inspect the facilities and address the grievances of patients.
During his visit, the Chairman was accompanied by the Medical Superintendent, doctors, and senior officers of the hospital.
He interacted with patients and their families, inquiring about the challenges they faced and issuing on-the-spot instructions to resolve their issues.
Chairman Randhawa emphasized the need to equip the hospital with modern techniques and ensure the provision of all necessary facilities, including tests and medicines, to patients.
He also visited various wards of the hospital and directed the authorities to improve cleanliness arrangements.
The Chairman announced plans to upgrade the Capital Hospital to international standards, enabling citizens from all walks of life to access quality healthcare services.
